wfIpv6BaseDelete.name: wfIpv6BaseDelete
wfIpv6BaseDelete.description: Create/Delete parameter. Default is created. Users perform a set operation on this object in order to create/delete IPv6.

wfIpv6BaseDisable.name: wfIpv6BaseDisable
wfIpv6BaseDisable.description: Enable/Disable parameter. Default is enabled. Users perform a set operation on this object in order to enable/disable IPv6.

wfIpv6BaseState.name: wfIpv6BaseState
wfIpv6BaseState.description: The current state of the entire IPv6.

wfIpv6BaseForwarding.name: wfIpv6BaseForwarding
wfIpv6BaseForwarding.description: The indication of whether this entity is acting as an IPv6 router in respect to the forwarding of datagrams received by, but not addressed to, this entity. IPv6 routers forward datagrams. IPv6 hosts do not (except those source-routed via the host). Note that for some managed nodes, this object may take on only a subset of the values possible. Accordingly, it is appropriate for an agent to return a `badValue' response if a management station attempts to change this object to an inappropriate value.

wfIpv6BaseDefaultHopLimit.name: wfIpv6BaseDefaultHopLimit
wfIpv6BaseDefaultHopLimit.description: The default value inserted into the 'Hop Limit' field of the IPv6 header of datagrams originated at this entity, whenever a Hop-Limit value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.

wfIpv6BaseMinLinkMTU.name: wfIpv6BaseMinLinkMTU
wfIpv6BaseMinLinkMTU.description: This parameter indicates the minimum link MTU that is assumed for every link in the IPv6 internet. IPv6 specification defines this value to be 576 bytes, which is the default value of this attribute. By changing this parameter to other number it is possible to control the maximum size of packets that can be generated by this router if the Path MTU discovery is disabled.

wfIpv6BaseMTUDiscovery.name: wfIpv6BaseMTUDiscovery
wfIpv6BaseMTUDiscovery.description: Whether the Path MTU discovery support for self-originated traffic is enabled/disabled

wfIpv6BaseMTUTimeout.name: wfIpv6BaseMTUTimeout
wfIpv6BaseMTUTimeout.description: Timeout period for discovered Path MTU value in minutes. 0 indicates infinite timeout period, i.e. no timeout.

wfIpv6BaseIfNumber.name: wfIpv6BaseIfNumber
wfIpv6BaseIfNumber.description: The number of network interfaces (regardless of their current state) present on this system.

wfIpv6BaseNetworks.name: wfIpv6BaseNetworks
wfIpv6BaseNetworks.description: The number of network layer reachability entries in the routing table

wfIpv6BaseNodes.name: wfIpv6BaseNodes
wfIpv6BaseNodes.description: This parameter indicates the number of nodes known by IPv6

wfIpv6BaseHighestFilterRule.name: wfIpv6BaseHighestFilterRule
wfIpv6BaseHighestFilterRule.description: The highest rule number (wfIpv6FilterNumber) that can be used in a traffic filter definition.

wfIpv6IfTable.name: wfIpv6IfTable
wfIpv6IfTable.description: The list of IPv6 interface entries. This is the configuration table of logical IPv6 interfaces at the network layer. An IPv6 interface constitutes a logical network layer attachment to a link ('circuit' in the Bay Networks terminology) at the subnetwork/datalink layer, i.e. the layer immediately below the network layer including internet layer 'tunnels', such as tunnels over IPv4 or IPv6 itself. In Bay Network routers a subnetwork link (a.k.a. circuit) is identified with a circuit id. One or more circuits can be configured on a physical link. One or more IPv6 logical interfaces can be configured on a given circuit.

wfIpv6IfEntry.name: wfIpv6IfEntry
wfIpv6IfEntry.description: An interface entry containing objects at the a particular IPv6 interface.

wfIpv6IfDelete.name: wfIpv6IfDelete
wfIpv6IfDelete.description: Create/Delete parameter. Default is created. Users perform a set operation on this object in order to create/delete an IPv6 interface.

wfIpv6IfDisable.name: wfIpv6IfDisable
wfIpv6IfDisable.description: Enable/Disable parameter. Default is enabled. Users perform a set operation on this object in order to enable/disable an IPv6 interface.

wfIpv6IfState.name: wfIpv6IfState
wfIpv6IfState.description: The current operational state of the interface. Tokenless state indicates the no valid address token is assigned to the interface. This state usually indicates that the link-local interface address failed Duplicate Address Detection. Invalid state indicates an error in processing the cfg record.

wfIpv6IfIndex.name: wfIpv6IfIndex
wfIpv6IfIndex.description: A unique non-zero value for each interface.

wfIpv6IfDescr.name: wfIpv6IfDescr
wfIpv6IfDescr.description: An optional textual string containing description of the interface.

wfIpv6IfCircuit.name: wfIpv6IfCircuit
wfIpv6IfCircuit.description: The Circuit Number that this interface runs over. If Circuit Number is between 1 and 1023, it identifies a subnetwork/datalink layer interface, i.e. the layer below the network layer. A subnetwork layer interface is associated with a physical link or, in some rare cases, with a group of physical links. Generally, more than one subnetwork layer interface can be defined on a physical link (e.g. channels on a T1 link). If the Circuit Number is higher that 1023, it's a circuitless interface, i.e. a logical IPv6 interface that is not associated with any subnetwork layer or physical layer interface. Zero indicates that it's a tunnel endpoint, i.e. IPv6 packets are encapsulated and transmitted by another network layer protocol or another instance of the IPv6 protocol.

wfIpv6IfCfgToken.name: wfIpv6IfCfgToken
wfIpv6IfCfgToken.description: The desired identifier (interface token) for this interface that is (at least) unique on the link this interface is attached to. The interface token is combined with an address prefix to form an interface address. If no token value is configured (the token length is zero), the interface token is autoconfigured according to the rules of the link type this interface is attached to.

wfIpv6IfCfgTokenLength.name: wfIpv6IfCfgTokenLength
wfIpv6IfCfgTokenLength.description: The length of the configured interface token in bits.

wfIpv6IfToken.name: wfIpv6IfToken
wfIpv6IfToken.description: The actual identifier (interface token) for this interface that is (at least) unique on the link this interface is attached to.

wfIpv6IfTokenLength.name: wfIpv6IfTokenLength
wfIpv6IfTokenLength.description: The length of the interface token in bits.

wfIpv6IfCfgPhysicalAddress.name: wfIpv6IfCfgPhysicalAddress
wfIpv6IfCfgPhysicalAddress.description: The desired link layer address set by the user

wfIpv6IfPhysicalAddress.name: wfIpv6IfPhysicalAddress
wfIpv6IfPhysicalAddress.description: The Physical Address for this Interface - actual one used

wfIpv6IfCfgLinkMTU.name: wfIpv6IfCfgLinkMTU
wfIpv6IfCfgLinkMTU.description: The configured link MTU. It will be only considered if it is less than the default MTU of the underlying media. A value of zero indicates that the default MTU of the underlying media is to be used.

wfIpv6IfFwdCacheSize.name: wfIpv6IfFwdCacheSize
wfIpv6IfFwdCacheSize.description: Maximum number of entries allowed in the Forwarding (Cache) Table at one time. There is a forwarding table per interface. If this attribute is set to zero, the Forwarding Cache is not used on this interface.

wfIpv6IfSlotMask.name: wfIpv6IfSlotMask
wfIpv6IfSlotMask.description: Slot mask for which slots a circuit-less interface is eligible to run on. The most significant bit represents slot 1, the next most significant bit represents slot 2, and so on... Slots can be 1-14. This is only valid if wfIpv6IfCircuit is greater than 1023.

wfIpv6IfLastChange.name: wfIpv6IfLastChange
wfIpv6IfLastChange.description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the node was last re-initialized at the time the interface entered its current operational state. Usually the time since boot.

wfIpv6IfReasmMaxSize.name: wfIpv6IfReasmMaxSize
wfIpv6IfReasmMaxSize.description: The size of the largest IPv6 datagram which this entity can re-assemble from incoming IPv6 fragmented packets received on this interface.

wfIpv6IfMaxInfo.name: wfIpv6IfMaxInfo
wfIpv6IfMaxInfo.description: The maximum size of the INFO (non-MAC) field that this port will receive or transmit (effective MTU size).

wfIpv6IfRedirect.name: wfIpv6IfRedirect
wfIpv6IfRedirect.description: Indicates whether we're sending out redirects on this Interface or not

wfIpv6IfIcmpErrorLimit.name: wfIpv6IfIcmpErrorLimit
wfIpv6IfIcmpErrorLimit.description: The maximum number of ICMP Error messages that is allowed to be transmitted within 1 second interval out of this interface.

wfIpv6IfTrEndStation.name: wfIpv6IfTrEndStation
wfIpv6IfTrEndStation.description: Use Source Routing over token ring selection. Only applies if a token ring interface.

wfIpv6IfTunnelProtocol.name: wfIpv6IfTunnelProtocol
wfIpv6IfTunnelProtocol.description: If wfIpv6IfCircuit is zero, this parameter specifies the tunnel protocol type: ip4st - IPv6-in-IPv4 static tunnel, ip6st - IPv6-in-Ipv6 static tunnel, ip4au - IPv6-in-IPv4 automatic tunnel, ip6au - IPv6-in-Ipv6 automatic tunnel, ip4sa - IPv6-in-Ipv4 semiautomatic tunnel, ip6sa - IPv6-in-Ipv6 semiautomatic tunnel. Static tunnels are tunnels where both local and remote endpoints must be defined. They are also called configured tunnels. Automatic tunnels are tunnels that don't have predefined remote address, i.e. the destination address of encapsulating header is derived from the destination address of encapsulated packet. They also called opened-end tunnels. A semiautomatic tunnel acts as a static tunnel for outgoing traffic and as an automatic (multipoint-to-point) tunnel for incoming traffic. Both local and remote endpoints must be configured.

wfIpv6IfIPv4TunnelLocalAddress.name: wfIpv6IfIPv4TunnelLocalAddress
wfIpv6IfIPv4TunnelLocalAddress.description: If wfIpv6IfCircuit is zero and the tunnel protocol type is IPv4 or ip4sa, this parameter contains the local IPv4 address of this interface's tunnel.

wfIpv6IfIPv4TunnelRemoteAddress.name: wfIpv6IfIPv4TunnelRemoteAddress
wfIpv6IfIPv4TunnelRemoteAddress.description: If wfIpv6IfCircuit is zero and the tunnel protocol type is IPv4 or ip4sa, this parameter contains the remote IPv4 address of this interface's tunnel. If this address is 0.0.0.0, this is interface to an automatic tunnel, i.e. the destination address of encapsulating header is derived from the destination address of encapsulated packet.

wfIpv6IfIpv6TunnelIfIndex.name: wfIpv6IfIpv6TunnelIfIndex
wfIpv6IfIpv6TunnelIfIndex.description: If wfIpv6IfCircuit is zero and the tunnel protocol type is IPv6 or ip6sa, this parameter contains the IPv6 interface index of the local end of this interface's tunnel.

wfIpv6IfIpv6TunnelRemoteAddress.name: wfIpv6IfIpv6TunnelRemoteAddress
wfIpv6IfIpv6TunnelRemoteAddress.description: If wfIpv6IfCircuit is zero and the tunnel protocol type is IPv6 or ip6sa, this parameter contains the remote IPv6 address of this interface's tunnel. If this address is unspecified (::0), this is interface to an automatic tunnel, i.e. the destination address of encapsulating header is derived from the destination address of encapsulated packet.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixTable.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixTable
wfIpv6AddrPrefixTable.description: The list of IPv6 address prefixes of IPv6 interfaces.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixEntry.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixEntry
wfIpv6AddrPrefixEntry.description: An interface entry containing objects of a particular IPv6 address prefix.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixDelete.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixDelete
wfIpv6AddrPrefixDelete.description: Create/Delete parameter. Default is created. Users perform a set operation on this object in order to create/delete this prefix entry.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixDisable.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixDisable
wfIpv6AddrPrefixDisable.description: Enable/Disable parameter. Default is enabled. Users perform a set operation on this object in order to enable/disable the use of a given prefix.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixIfIndex.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixIfIndex
wfIpv6AddrPrefixIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the IPv6 interface to which this entry is applicable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of wfIpv6IfIndex.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixIndex.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixIndex
wfIpv6AddrPrefixIndex.description: A index value identifying this prefix on the IPv6 interface to which this entry's addressing information pertains.

wfIpv6AddrPrefix.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefix
wfIpv6AddrPrefix.description: The prefix associated with the IPv6 address of this interface.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixLength.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixLength
wfIpv6AddrPrefixLength.description: The length of the prefix (in bits) associated with the IPv6 address of this entry. A prefix can not be shorter than 3 bits.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixPreference.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixPreference
wfIpv6AddrPrefixPreference.description: The Routing Preference in 0 to 15 range. A value of 15 is `most preferred'. Default 15.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixCost.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixCost
wfIpv6AddrPrefixCost.description: The Cost metric associated with this entry. (Used as the RIP metric)

wfIpv6AddrPrefixOnLinkFlag.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixOnLinkFlag
wfIpv6AddrPrefixOnLinkFlag.description: On-link flag. When set (1), indicates that this prefix can be used for on-link determination.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixAutonomousFlag.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixAutonomousFlag
wfIpv6AddrPrefixAutonomousFlag.description: Autonomous address configuration flag. When set (1), indicates that this prefix can be used for autonomous address configuration (i.e. can be used to form a local interface address). If off(2), it is not used to form a local interface address but it is advertised in ND's Router Advertisements.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixAdvPreferredLifetime.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixAdvPreferredLifetime
wfIpv6AddrPrefixAdvPreferredLifetime.description: The value to be placed in the Preferred Lifetime field in the Prefix Information option of Router Advertisements. It is the length of time in seconds (relative to the time the Router Advertisement is sent) that this prefix will remain preferred, i.e. time until deprecation. A value of 0xffffffff represents infinity. The address generated from a deprecated prefix should no longer be used as a source address in new communications, but packets received on such an interface are processed as expected.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixAdvValidLifetime.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixAdvValidLifetime
wfIpv6AddrPrefixAdvValidLifetime.description: The value to be placed in the Valid Lifetime field in the Prefix Information option of Router Advertisements. It is the length of time in seconds (relative to the time the Router Advertisement is sent) that this prefix will remain valid, i.e. time until invalidation. A value of 0xffffffff (-1) represents infinity. The address generated from an invalidated prefix should not appear as the destination or source address of a packet.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixInvalid.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixInvalid
wfIpv6AddrPrefixInvalid.description: Whether this entry is valid or not: valid - usable prefix, invalid - misconfigured.

wfIpv6AddrPrefixAnycast.name: wfIpv6AddrPrefixAnycast
wfIpv6AddrPrefixAnycast.description: Whether this prefix is an anycast address prefix: true - anycast address prefix, false - unicast address prefix.

wfIpv6AddrTable.name: wfIpv6AddrTable
wfIpv6AddrTable.description: The table of addressing information relevant to this node's interface addresses.

wfIpv6AddrEntry.name: wfIpv6AddrEntry
wfIpv6AddrEntry.description: The addressing information for one of this node's interface addresses.

wfIpv6AddrIfIndex.name: wfIpv6AddrIfIndex
wfIpv6AddrIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the IPv6 interface to which this entry is applicable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of wfIpv6IfIndex.

wfIpv6AddrAddress.name: wfIpv6AddrAddress
wfIpv6AddrAddress.description: The IPv6 address to which this entry's addressing information pertains.

wfIpv6AddrPfxLength.name: wfIpv6AddrPfxLength
wfIpv6AddrPfxLength.description: The length of the prefix (in bits) associated with the IPv6 address of this entry.

wfIpv6AddrType.name: wfIpv6AddrType
wfIpv6AddrType.description: The type of address. Note that 'stateless(2)' refers to an address that was statelessly autoconfigured; 'stateful(3)' refers to a address which was acquired by via a stateful protocol (e.g. DHCPv6, manual configuration)

wfIpv6AddrAnycastFlag.name: wfIpv6AddrAnycastFlag
wfIpv6AddrAnycastFlag.description: This object has the value 'true(1)', if this address is an anycast address and the value 'false(2)' otherwise.

wfIpv6AddrStatus.name: wfIpv6AddrStatus
wfIpv6AddrStatus.description: Address status. The preferred(1) state indicates that this is a valid address that can appear as the destination or source address of a packet. The deprecated(2) this is a valid but deprecated address that should no longer be used as a source address in new communications, but packets addressed to such an address are processed as expected. The invalid(3) state indicates that this is not valid address which should not appear as the destination or source address of a packet. The inaccessible(4) state indicates the address is not accessible because the interface to which this address is assigned is not operational.

wfIpv6IfStatsEntry.name: wfIpv6IfStatsEntry
wfIpv6IfStatsEntry.description: An interface statistics entry containing objects at a particular IPv6 interface.

wfIpv6IfStatsIfIndex.name: wfIpv6IfStatsIfIndex
wfIpv6IfStatsIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the IPv6 interface to which this entry is applicable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of wfIpv6IfIndex.

wfIpv6IfStatsInReceives.name: wfIpv6IfStatsInReceives
wfIpv6IfStatsInReceives.description: The total number of input datagrams received from interfaces, including those received in error.

wfIpv6IfStatsInHdrErrors.name: wfIpv6IfStatsInHdrErrors
wfIpv6IfStatsInHdrErrors.description: The number of input datagrams discarded due to errors in their IPv6 headers, including version number mismatch, other format errors, hop count exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IPv6 options, etc.

wfIpv6IfStatsInTooBigErrors.name: wfIpv6IfStatsInTooBigErrors
wfIpv6IfStatsInTooBigErrors.description: The number of input datagrams that could not be forwarded because their size exceeded the link MTU of outgoing interface.

wfIpv6IfStatsInNoRoutes.name: wfIpv6IfStatsInNoRoutes
wfIpv6IfStatsInNoRoutes.description: The number of input datagrams discarded because no route could be found to transmit them to their destination.

wfIpv6IfStatsInAddrErrors.name: wfIpv6IfStatsInAddrErrors
wfIpv6IfStatsInAddrErrors.description: The number of input datagrams discarded because the IPv6 address in their IPv6 header's destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity. This count includes invalid addresses (e.g., ::0) and unsupported addresses (e.g., addresses with unallocated prefixes). For entities which are not IPv6 routers and therefore do not forward datagrams, this counter includes datagrams discarded because the destination address was not a local address.

wfIpv6IfStatsInUnknownProtos.name: wfIpv6IfStatsInUnknownProtos
wfIpv6IfStatsInUnknownProtos.description: The number of locally-addressed datagrams received successfully but discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

wfIpv6IfStatsInDiscards.name: wfIpv6IfStatsInDiscards
wfIpv6IfStatsInDiscards.description: The number of input IPv6 datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but which were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). Note that this counter does not include any datagrams discarded while awaiting re-assembly.

wfIpv6IfStatsInDelivers.name: wfIpv6IfStatsInDelivers
wfIpv6IfStatsInDelivers.description: The total number of input datagrams successfully delivered to IPv6 user-protocols (including ICMP).

wfIpv6IfStatsForwDatagrams.name: wfIpv6IfStatsForwDatagrams
wfIpv6IfStatsForwDatagrams.description: The number of output datagrams which this entity received and forwarded to their final destinations. In entities which do not act as IPv6 routers, this counter will include only those packets which were Source-Routed via this entity, and the Source-Route processing was successful. Note that for a successfully forwarded datagram the counter of the outgoing interface is incremented.

wfIpv6IfStatsOutRequests.name: wfIpv6IfStatsOutRequests
wfIpv6IfStatsOutRequests.description: The total number of IPv6 datagrams which local IPv6 user-protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IPv6 in requests for transmission. Note that this counter does not include any datagrams counted in wfIpv6IfStatsForwDatagrams.

wfIpv6IfStatsOutDiscards.name: wfIpv6IfStatsOutDiscards
wfIpv6IfStatsOutDiscards.description: The number of output IPv6 datagrams for which no problem was encountered to prevent their transmission to their destination, but which were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). Note that this counter would include datagrams counted in wfIpv6IfStatsForwDatagrams if any such packets met this (discretionary) discard criterion.

wfIpv6IfStatsFragOKs.name: wfIpv6IfStatsFragOKs
wfIpv6IfStatsFragOKs.description: The number of IPv6 datagrams that have been successfully fragmented at this output interface.

wfIpv6IfStatsFragFails.name: wfIpv6IfStatsFragFails
wfIpv6IfStatsFragFails.description: The number of IPv6 datagrams that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented at this output interface but could not be.

wfIpv6IfStatsFragCreates.name: wfIpv6IfStatsFragCreates
wfIpv6IfStatsFragCreates.description: The number of output datagram fragments that have been generated as a result of fragmentation at this output interface.

wfIpv6IfStatsCacheMisses.name: wfIpv6IfStatsCacheMisses
wfIpv6IfStatsCacheMisses.description: The number of FFT cache misses (i.e how many times did the cache gate have to do a look up in the RNP because the FFT didn't have the destination network

wfIpv6IfStatsCacheNetworks.name: wfIpv6IfStatsCacheNetworks
wfIpv6IfStatsCacheNetworks.description: The number of network entries in the forwarding cache

wfIpv6IfStatsCacheRemoves.name: wfIpv6IfStatsCacheRemoves
wfIpv6IfStatsCacheRemoves.description: The number of networks which have been flushed from the forwarding cache

wfIpv6IfStatsReasmReqds.name: wfIpv6IfStatsReasmReqds
wfIpv6IfStatsReasmReqds.description: The number of IPv6 fragments received which needed to be reassembled at this interface. Note that this counter is incremented at the interface to which these fragments were addressed which might not be necessarily the input interface for some of the fragments.

wfIpv6IfStatsReasmOKs.name: wfIpv6IfStatsReasmOKs
wfIpv6IfStatsReasmOKs.description: The number of IPv6 datagrams successfully reassembled.

wfIpv6IfStatsReasmFails.name: wfIpv6IfStatsReasmFails
wfIpv6IfStatsReasmFails.description: The number of failures detected by the IPv6 re- assembly algorithm (for whatever reason: timed out, errors, etc). Note that this is not necessarily a count of discarded IPv6 fragments since some algorithms (notably the algorithm in RFC 815) can lose track of the number of fragments by combining them as they are received. This counter is incremented at the interface to which these fragments were addressed which might not be necessarily the input interface for some of the fragments.

wfIpv6IfStatsMcastInPkts.name: wfIpv6IfStatsMcastInPkts
wfIpv6IfStatsMcastInPkts.description: The number of multicast packets received by the interface

wfIpv6IfStatsMcastOutPkts.name: wfIpv6IfStatsMcastOutPkts
wfIpv6IfStatsMcastOutPkts.description: The number of multicast packets transmitted by the interface

wfIpv6IfStatsInTruncatedPkts.name: wfIpv6IfStatsInTruncatedPkts
wfIpv6IfStatsInTruncatedPkts.description: The number of input datagrams discarded because datagram frame didn't carry enough data

wfIpv6StaticRouteDelete.name: wfIpv6StaticRouteDelete
wfIpv6StaticRouteDelete.description: Create/Delete parameter. Default is created. Users perform a set operation on this object in order to create/delete the IPv6 Static Route.

wfIpv6StaticRouteDisable.name: wfIpv6StaticRouteDisable
wfIpv6StaticRouteDisable.description: Enable/Disable parameter. Default is enabled. Users perform a set operation on this object in order to enable/disable this IPv6 Static Route.

wfIpv6StaticRouteIfIndex.name: wfIpv6StaticRouteIfIndex
wfIpv6StaticRouteIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the local IPv6 interface to be used for forwarding to this Next Hop. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of wfIpv6IfIndex. If this parameter is 0, this is a black-hole route, i.e. packets to destinations matching this route are to be discarded.

wfIpv6StaticRouteId.name: wfIpv6StaticRouteId
wfIpv6StaticRouteId.description: The Route Identifier: which numbered route this is to be

wfIpv6StaticRoutePfx.name: wfIpv6StaticRoutePfx
wfIpv6StaticRoutePfx.description: The destination IPv6 address prefix of this static route

wfIpv6StaticRoutePfxLength.name: wfIpv6StaticRoutePfxLength
wfIpv6StaticRoutePfxLength.description: The length (in bits) of the address prefix for this static route

wfIpv6StaticRouteNextHopAddr.name: wfIpv6StaticRouteNextHopAddr
wfIpv6StaticRouteNextHopAddr.description: The IPv6 Address of the next hop node. This parameter is ignored for black-hole static routes.

wfIpv6StaticRoutePreference.name: wfIpv6StaticRoutePreference
wfIpv6StaticRoutePreference.description: The Routing Preference in 0 to 15 range. A value of 15 is 'most preferred'. Default 15.

wfIpv6StaticRouteCost.name: wfIpv6StaticRouteCost
wfIpv6StaticRouteCost.description: The Cost of this Static Route. (Used as the RIP metric)

wfIpv6StaticRouteInvalid.name: wfIpv6StaticRouteInvalid
wfIpv6StaticRouteInvalid.description: Whether this Static Route is valid or not

wfIpv6AdjacentNodeTable.name: wfIpv6AdjacentNodeTable
wfIpv6AdjacentNodeTable.description: The list of Adjacent Static Nodes (static IPv6->MAC resolutions)

wfIpv6AdjacentNodeEntry.name: wfIpv6AdjacentNodeEntry
wfIpv6AdjacentNodeEntry.description: A description of an adjacent node

wfIpv6AdjNodeDelete.name: wfIpv6AdjNodeDelete
wfIpv6AdjNodeDelete.description: Whether to Delete this Adjacent Node

wfIpv6AdjNodeDisable.name: wfIpv6AdjNodeDisable
wfIpv6AdjNodeDisable.description: Whether to Disable this Adjacent Node

wfIpv6AdjNodeIfIndex.name: wfIpv6AdjNodeIfIndex
wfIpv6AdjNodeIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the local IPv6 interface through which this Adjacent Node should be reached. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of wfIpv6IfIndex. If this index is zero, this Adjacent Node is this router itself, i.e. 'wfIpv6AdjNodeAddress' address is treated as a router's own local address. IPv6 datagrams with such a destination address are considered to be consumed by this router itself. As an example, such an address can be an IPv6 anycast address assigned to this router.

wfIpv6AdjNodeAddress.name: wfIpv6AdjNodeAddress
wfIpv6AdjNodeAddress.description: The IPv6 address of this Adjacent Node

wfIpv6AdjNodePhysicalAddr.name: wfIpv6AdjNodePhysicalAddr
wfIpv6AdjNodePhysicalAddr.description: The Physical Address for this Adjacent Node. For FR PVC it is a 32 bit DLCI. For ATM PVC it is a 32 bit VCID which has circuit VCI in its most significant 20 bits and VPI in 12 least significant bits.

wfIpv6AdjNodeEncaps.name: wfIpv6AdjNodeEncaps
wfIpv6AdjNodeEncaps.description: The link layer encapsulation type of this entry. 'Snap(2)' is to be specified only if IEEE 802.2 encapsulation is to be used over CSMACD or DS1 links. For 'pdn(4)', X.121 address is stored in wfIpv6AdjNodeWanAddr. For 'wan(3)', X.121 or E.164 FR address is stored in wfIpv6AdjNodeWanAddr.

wfIpv6AdjNodePreference.name: wfIpv6AdjNodePreference
wfIpv6AdjNodePreference.description: The Routing Preference in 0 to 15 range. A value of 15 is 'most preferred'. Default 15.

wfIpv6AdjNodeCost.name: wfIpv6AdjNodeCost
wfIpv6AdjNodeCost.description: The Cost of this Adjacent Node. (Used as the RIP metric)

wfIpv6AdjNodeInvalid.name: wfIpv6AdjNodeInvalid
wfIpv6AdjNodeInvalid.description: Whether the record passed validation or not

wfIpv6AdjNodeWanAddr.name: wfIpv6AdjNodeWanAddr
wfIpv6AdjNodeWanAddr.description: WAN address (X.121, E.164, etc.) used to establish an SVC to the adjacent host. For X.25 PVC it contains LCN of the PVC encoded as a X.121 address uo to 4 octets in length.

wfIpv6RouteDest.name: wfIpv6RouteDest
wfIpv6RouteDest.description: The destination IPv6 address of this route. An entry with a value of ::0 is considered a default route. This object may not take a Multicast address value.

wfIpv6RoutePfxLength.name: wfIpv6RoutePfxLength
wfIpv6RoutePfxLength.description: Indicates the prefix length of the destination address.

wfIpv6RouteIfIndex.name: wfIpv6RouteIfIndex
wfIpv6RouteIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the local interface through which the next hop of this route should be reached. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of wfIpv6IfIndex.

wfIpv6RouteIndex.name: wfIpv6RouteIndex
wfIpv6RouteIndex.description: The value which uniquely identifies the route among the routes to the same network layer destination

wfIpv6RouteNextHop.name: wfIpv6RouteNextHop
wfIpv6RouteNextHop.description: On remote routes, the address of the next system en route; Otherwise, ::0

wfIpv6RouteType.name: wfIpv6RouteType
wfIpv6RouteType.description: The type of route. Note that 'direct(3)' refers to a route for which the next hop is the final destination; 'indirect(4)' refers to a route for which the next hop is not the final destination; 'discard(5)' refers to a route indicating that packets to destinations matching this route are to be discarded (sometimes called black-hole route).

wfIpv6RouteProtocol.name: wfIpv6RouteProtocol
wfIpv6RouteProtocol.description: The routing mechanism via which this route was learned.

wfIpv6RoutePolicy.name: wfIpv6RoutePolicy
wfIpv6RoutePolicy.description: The general set of conditions that would cause the selection of one multipath route (set of next hops for a given destination) is referred to as 'policy'. Unless the mechanism indicated by wfIpv6RouteProtocol specified otherwise, the policy specifier is the Priority field of the IPv6 packet header. The encoding of IPv6 Priority is specified by the following convention: 0 - uncharacterized traffic 1 - 'filler' traffic (e.g., netnews) 2 - unattended data transfer (e.g., email) 3 - reserved 4 - attended bulk transfer (e.g., FTP, NFS) 5 - reserved 6 - interactive traffic (e.g., telnet, X) 7 - internet control traffic (e.g., routing protocols, SNMP) Protocols defining 'policy' otherwise must either define a set of values which are valid for this object or must implement an integer- instanced policy table for which this object's value acts as an index.

wfIpv6RouteAge.name: wfIpv6RouteAge
wfIpv6RouteAge.description: The number of seconds since this route was last updated or otherwise determined to be correct. Note that no semantics of `too old' can be implied except through knowledge of the routing protocol by which the route was learned.

wfIpv6RouteNextHopRDI.name: wfIpv6RouteNextHopRDI
wfIpv6RouteNextHopRDI.description: The Routing Domain ID of the Next Hop. When this is unknown or not relevant to the protocol indicated by ipv6RouteProtocol, it is an octet string of zero size.

wfIpv6RouteMetric.name: wfIpv6RouteMetric
wfIpv6RouteMetric.description: The routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing protocol specified in the route's ipv6RouteProtocol value. When this is unknown or not relevant to the protocol indicated by ipv6RouteProtocol, the object value should be set to its maximum value (4,294,967,295).

wfIpv6RouteWeight.name: wfIpv6RouteWeight
wfIpv6RouteWeight.description: The system internal weight value for this route. The semantics of this value are determined by the implementation specific rules. Generally, within routes with the same wfIpv6RoutePolicy value, the lower the weight value the more preferred is the route.

wfIpv6RouteInfo.name: wfIpv6RouteInfo
wfIpv6RouteInfo.description: A reference to MIB definitions specific to the particular routing protocol which is responsible for this route, as determined by the value specified in the route's wfIpv6RouteProto value. If this information is not present, its value should be set to the OBJECT ID { 0 0 }, which is a syntactically valid object identifier, and any implementation conforming to ASN.1 and the Basic Encoding Rules must be able to generate and recognize this value.

wfIpv6NetToMediaEntryTable.name: wfIpv6NetToMediaEntryTable
wfIpv6NetToMediaEntryTable.description: The IPv6 address translation table contain the IPv6 Address to `physical' address equivalences. Some interfaces do not use translation tables for determining address equivalences; if all interfaces are of this type, then the Address Translation table is empty, i.e., has zero entries.

wfIpv6NetToMediaEntry.name: wfIpv6NetToMediaEntry
wfIpv6NetToMediaEntry.description: A description of a resolved node

wfIpv6NetToMediaIfIndex.name: wfIpv6NetToMediaIfIndex
wfIpv6NetToMediaIfIndex.description: The interface on which this entry's equivalence is effective. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of wfIpv6IfIndex.

wfIpv6NetToMediaNetAddress.name: wfIpv6NetToMediaNetAddress
wfIpv6NetToMediaNetAddress.description: The IPv6 Address corresponding to the media-dependent `physical' address.

wfIpv6NetToMediaInvalid.name: wfIpv6NetToMediaInvalid
wfIpv6NetToMediaInvalid.description: Setting this object to the value invalid(2) has the effect of invalidating the corresponding entry in the wfIpv6NetToMediaTable. That is, it effectively disassociates the interface identified with said entry from the mapping identified with said entry. It is an implementation-specific matter as to whether the agent removes an invalidated entry from the table. Accordingly, management stations must be prepared to receive tabular information from agents that corresponds to entries not currently in use. Proper interpretation of such entries requires examination of the relevant wfIpv6NetToMediaInvalid object.

wfIpv6DbgInfoEntry.name: wfIpv6DbgInfoEntry
wfIpv6DbgInfoEntry.description: A description of a IPV6_NDISC interface

wfIpv6DbgInfoState.name: wfIpv6DbgInfoState
wfIpv6DbgInfoState.description: The current state of IPv6 on this slot.

wfIpv6DbgInfoNetworks.name: wfIpv6DbgInfoNetworks
wfIpv6DbgInfoNetworks.description: The number of network layer reachability entries in the routing table on this slot

wfIpv6DbgInfoNodes.name: wfIpv6DbgInfoNodes
wfIpv6DbgInfoNodes.description: This parameter indicates the number of nodes known by IPv6 on this slot.

wfIpv6DbgInfoActiveInterfaces.name: wfIpv6DbgInfoActiveInterfaces
wfIpv6DbgInfoActiveInterfaces.description: The number of active IPv6 interface on this slot.

wfIpv6DbgInfoRtmAddr.name: wfIpv6DbgInfoRtmAddr
wfIpv6DbgInfoRtmAddr.description: Memory address of IPv6 RTM Environment on this slot.

wfIpv6FilterDelete.name: wfIpv6FilterDelete
wfIpv6FilterDelete.description: Create/Delete parameter. Default is created. Users perform a set operation on this object in order to create/delete an IPv6 filtering rule.

wfIpv6FilterDisable.name: wfIpv6FilterDisable
wfIpv6FilterDisable.description: Enable/Disable parameter. Default is enabled. Users perform a set operation on this object in order to enable/disable an IPv6 filtering rule.

wfIpv6FilterName.name: wfIpv6FilterName
wfIpv6FilterName.description: Rule name - user specified name for this filter

wfIpv6FilterPrecedence.name: wfIpv6FilterPrecedence
wfIpv6FilterPrecedence.description: Precedence. This is a metric to be used to compare this policy rule to other rules that a given packet may match. A rule with a higher precedence value will be chosen over one with a smaller value. In the case of a tie, the rule index is used (lower wins). Note: if there is multiple filters that a given packet may match, it is advisable for a filter with a higher precedence value to be defined with a lower rule index than a filter with a lower precedence value to improve forwarding performance.

wfIpv6FilterPackets.name: wfIpv6FilterPackets
wfIpv6FilterPackets.description: The number of packets received that have matched this rule.

wfIpv6FilterOctets.name: wfIpv6FilterOctets
wfIpv6FilterOctets.description: The total number of octets in packets received that have matched this rule.

wfIpv6FilterInIfIndex.name: wfIpv6FilterInIfIndex
wfIpv6FilterInIfIndex.description: Interface index which uniquely identifies the incoming IPv6 interface to which this entry is applicable. An interface identified by a particular value in this object is the same interface as identified by the same value of wfIpv6IfIndex. The index value of 0 means 'match any interface'.

wfIpv6FilterOutIfIndex.name: wfIpv6FilterOutIfIndex
wfIpv6FilterOutIfIndex.description: Interface index which uniquely identifies the outgoing IPv6 interface to which this entry is applicable. An interface identified by a particular value in this object is the same interface as identified by the same value of wfIpv6IfIndex. The index value of 0 means 'match any interface', i.e. all packets that are to be forwarded will match this filter parameter. Note that packet which are addressed to the router itself will not match a filter that has zero as its wfIpv6FilterOutIfIndex value. The index value of -1 means that only packets which are addressed to the router itself match this filter parameter. The index value of -2 means that all packets, forwarded or addressed to the router itself, match this filter parameter.

wfIpv6FilterSrcAddresses.name: wfIpv6FilterSrcAddresses
wfIpv6FilterSrcAddresses.description: Source Address identification list. This identifies which packet source addresses will match this rule. If non-null, the octet string contains one or more 2-tuples of this form: 16 octets: address prefix 1 octet: prefix length in bits An encoding ::0/0 means 'match any address'. A null string also means 'match any address'.

wfIpv6FilterDstAddresses.name: wfIpv6FilterDstAddresses
wfIpv6FilterDstAddresses.description: Destination Address identification list. This identifies which packet destination addresses will match this rule. If non-null, the octet string contains one or more 2-tuples of this form: 16 octets: address prefix 1 octet: prefix length An encoding ::0/0 means 'match any address'. A null string also means 'match any address'.

wfIpv6FilterProtocols.name: wfIpv6FilterProtocols
wfIpv6FilterProtocols.description: List of upper layer protocol types (e.g., UDP is 16, TCP is 6, ICMP is 58) of the packet payload. If non-null, the octet string contains one or more 3-tuples of this form: 1 octet: protocol type (zero means 'any protocol') 2 octets: value of the first 16 bits of upper-layer payload (zero means 'any value')* 2 octets: value of the next 16 bits of upper-layer payload (zero means 'any value')* For UDP and TCP protocol the first 16 bits of payload correspond to the source port number and the next 16 bits of payload correspond to the destination port number. *If the protocol type is ICMP(58), the first 2-octets value identifies the ICMP Type and second 2-octets value should be set to 0. A null string also means 'match any protocol'.

wfIpv6FilterAction.name: wfIpv6FilterAction
wfIpv6FilterAction.description: action. If 'forward(1), packet is to be forwarded; if 'discard(2)', packet is to be discarded

wfIpv6FilterLog.name: wfIpv6FilterLog
wfIpv6FilterLog.description: Log Action. If 'true(1), a log event is generated when a packet matches this filter rule; if 'false(2)', no logging is done.

wfIpv6IcmpEntry.name: wfIpv6IcmpEntry
wfIpv6IcmpEntry.description: An ICMPv6 statistics entry containing objects at a particular IPv6 interface. Note that a receiving interface is the interface to which a given ICMPv6 message is addressed which may not be necessarily the input interface for the message. Similarly, the sending interface is the interface that sources a given ICMP message which is usually but not necessarily the output interface for the message.

wfIpv6IcmpIfIndex.name: wfIpv6IcmpIfIndex
wfIpv6IcmpIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the local interface to which this entry's information pertains. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of wfIpv6IfIndex.

wfIpv6IcmpInMsgs.name: wfIpv6IcmpInMsgs
wfIpv6IcmpInMsgs.description: The total number of ICMP messages which includes all those counted by wfIpv6IcmpInErrors.

wfIpv6IcmpInErrors.name: wfIpv6IcmpInErrors
wfIpv6IcmpInErrors.description: The number of ICMP messages which the entity received but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.).

wfIpv6IcmpInDestUnreachs.name: wfIpv6IcmpInDestUnreachs
wfIpv6IcmpInDestUnreachs.description: The number of ICMP Destination Unreachable messages received.

wfIpv6IcmpInAdminProhibs.name: wfIpv6IcmpInAdminProhibs
wfIpv6IcmpInAdminProhibs.description: Number of ICMP dest unreachable/communication administratively prohibited messages received. Note: may be sent by BFE or another system

wfIpv6IcmpInTimeExcds.name: wfIpv6IcmpInTimeExcds
wfIpv6IcmpInTimeExcds.description: The number of ICMP Time Exceeded messages received.

wfIpv6IcmpInParmProbs.name: wfIpv6IcmpInParmProbs
wfIpv6IcmpInParmProbs.description: The number of ICMP Parameter Problem messages received.

wfIpv6IcmpInPktTooBigs.name: wfIpv6IcmpInPktTooBigs
wfIpv6IcmpInPktTooBigs.description: The number of ICMP Packet Too Big messages received.

wfIpv6IcmpInEchos.name: wfIpv6IcmpInEchos
wfIpv6IcmpInEchos.description: The number of ICMP Echo (request) messages received.

wfIpv6IcmpInEchoReps.name: wfIpv6IcmpInEchoReps
wfIpv6IcmpInEchoReps.description: The number of ICMP Echo Reply messages received.

wfIpv6IcmpInRouterSolicits.name: wfIpv6IcmpInRouterSolicits
wfIpv6IcmpInRouterSolicits.description: The number of ICMP Router Solicit messages received.

wfIpv6IcmpInRouterAdvertisements.name: wfIpv6IcmpInRouterAdvertisements
wfIpv6IcmpInRouterAdvertisements.description: The number of ICMP Router Advertisement messages received.

wfIpv6IcmpInNeighborSolicits.name: wfIpv6IcmpInNeighborSolicits
wfIpv6IcmpInNeighborSolicits.description: The number of ICMP Neighbor Solicit messages received.

wfIpv6IcmpInNeighborAdvertisements.name: wfIpv6IcmpInNeighborAdvertisements
wfIpv6IcmpInNeighborAdvertisements.description: The number of ICMP Neighbor Advertisement messages received.

wfIpv6IcmpInRedirects.name: wfIpv6IcmpInRedirects
wfIpv6IcmpInRedirects.description: The number of Redirect messages received.

wfIpv6IcmpInGroupMembQueries.name: wfIpv6IcmpInGroupMembQueries
wfIpv6IcmpInGroupMembQueries.description: The number of ICMPv6 Group Membership Query messages received by the interface.

wfIpv6IcmpInGroupMembResponses.name: wfIpv6IcmpInGroupMembResponses
wfIpv6IcmpInGroupMembResponses.description: The number of ICMPv6 Group Membership Response messages received by the interface.

wfIpv6IcmpInGroupMembReductions.name: wfIpv6IcmpInGroupMembReductions
wfIpv6IcmpInGroupMembReductions.description: The number of ICMPv6 Group Membership Reduction messages received by the interface.

wfIpv6IcmpOutMsgs.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutMsgs
wfIpv6IcmpOutMsgs.description: The total number of ICMP messages which this entity attempted to send. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpOutErrors.

wfIpv6IcmpOutErrors.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutErrors
wfIpv6IcmpOutErrors.description: The number of ICMP messages which this entity did not send due to problems discovered within ICMP such as a lack of buffers. This value should not include errors discovered outside the ICMP layer such as the inability of IPv6 to route the resultant datagram. In some implementations there may be no types of error which contribute to this counter's value.

wfIpv6IcmpOutDestUnreachs.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutDestUnreachs
wfIpv6IcmpOutDestUnreachs.description: The number of ICMP Destination Unreachable messages sent.

wfIpv6IcmpOutAdminProhibs.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutAdminProhibs
wfIpv6IcmpOutAdminProhibs.description: Number of ICMP dest unreachable/communication administratively prohibited messages sent.

wfIpv6IcmpOutTimeExcds.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutTimeExcds
wfIpv6IcmpOutTimeExcds.description: The number of ICMP Time Exceeded messages sent.

wfIpv6IcmpOutParmProbs.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutParmProbs
wfIpv6IcmpOutParmProbs.description: The number of ICMP Parameter Problem messages sent.

wfIpv6IcmpOutPktTooBigs.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutPktTooBigs
wfIpv6IcmpOutPktTooBigs.description: The number of ICMP Packet Too Big messages sent.

wfIpv6IcmpOutEchos.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutEchos
wfIpv6IcmpOutEchos.description: The number of ICMP Echo (request) messages sent.

wfIpv6IcmpOutEchoReps.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutEchoReps
wfIpv6IcmpOutEchoReps.description: The number of ICMP Echo Reply messages sent.

wfIpv6IcmpOutRouterSolicits.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutRouterSolicits
wfIpv6IcmpOutRouterSolicits.description: The number of ICMP Router Solicitation messages sent.

wfIpv6IcmpOutRouterAdvertisements.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutRouterAdvertisements
wfIpv6IcmpOutRouterAdvertisements.description: The number of ICMP Router Advertisement messages received.

wfIpv6IcmpOutNeighborSolicits.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutNeighborSolicits
wfIpv6IcmpOutNeighborSolicits.description: The number of ICMP Neighbor Solicitation messages sent.

wfIpv6IcmpOutNeighborAdvertisements.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutNeighborAdvertisements
wfIpv6IcmpOutNeighborAdvertisements.description: The number of ICMP Neighbor Advertisement messages received.

wfIpv6IcmpOutRedirects.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutRedirects
wfIpv6IcmpOutRedirects.description: The number of Redirect messages sent. For a host, this object will always be zero, since hosts do not send redirects.

wfIpv6IcmpOutGroupMembQueries.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutGroupMembQueries
wfIpv6IcmpOutGroupMembQueries.description: The number of ICMPv6 Group Membership Query messages sent

wfIpv6IcmpOutGroupMembResponses.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutGroupMembResponses
wfIpv6IcmpOutGroupMembResponses.description: The number of ICMPv6 Group Membership Response messages sent

wfIpv6IcmpOutGroupMembReductions.name: wfIpv6IcmpOutGroupMembReductions
wfIpv6IcmpOutGroupMembReductions.description: The number of ICMPv6 Group Membership Reduction messages sent

wfIpv6NdiscIfTable.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfTable
wfIpv6NdiscIfTable.description: The list of configured Neighbor Discovery (ND) interfaces

wfIpv6NdiscIfEntry.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfEntry
wfIpv6NdiscIfEntry.description: A description of a IPV6_NDISC interface

wfIpv6NdiscIfDelete.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfDelete
wfIpv6NdiscIfDelete.description: Create/Delete parameter. Default is created. Users perform a set operation on this object in order to create/delete an IPV6_NDISC Interface instance.

wfIpv6NdiscIfDisable.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfDisable
wfIpv6NdiscIfDisable.description: Enable/Disable parameter. Default is enabled. Users perform a set operation on this object in order to enable/disable a IPV6_NDISC interface.

wfIpv6NdiscIfState.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfState
wfIpv6NdiscIfState.description: The current state of IPV6_NDISC on this interface.

wfIpv6NdiscIfIndex.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfIndex
wfIpv6NdiscIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the local interface to which this entry's information pertains. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of wfIpv6IfIndex.

wfIpv6NdiscIfSendAdvertisements.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfSendAdvertisements
wfIpv6NdiscIfSendAdvertisements.description: Indicates whether or not periodic Router Advertisements are to be sent.

wfIpv6NdiscIfManagedFlag.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfManagedFlag
wfIpv6NdiscIfManagedFlag.description: Managed Address Configuration flag. When set, hosts use the administered (stateful) protocol for address autoconfiguration in addition to any addresses autoconfigured using stateless address autoconfiguration.

wfIpv6NdiscIfOtherCfgFlag.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfOtherCfgFlag
wfIpv6NdiscIfOtherCfgFlag.description: Other Stateful Configuration flag. When set, hosts use the administered (stateful) protocol for autoconfiguration of non-address information.

wfIpv6NdiscIfReachableTime.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfReachableTime
wfIpv6NdiscIfReachableTime.description: The time, in milliseconds, that a node assumes a neighbor is reachable after having received a reachability confirmation. A value of zero means unspecified (by this router).

wfIpv6NdiscIfRetransTimer.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfRetransTimer
wfIpv6NdiscIfRetransTimer.description: The time, in milliseconds, between retransmitted Neighbor Solicitation messages. A value of zero means unspecified (by this router).

wfIpv6NdiscIfMaxHopLimit.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfMaxHopLimit
wfIpv6NdiscIfMaxHopLimit.description: Maximum hop limit (network diameter) to advertise

wfIpv6NdiscIfMinRtrAdvInterval.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfMinRtrAdvInterval
wfIpv6NdiscIfMinRtrAdvInterval.description: The minimum time allowed between sending unsolicited multicast Router Advertisements, in seconds.

wfIpv6NdiscIfMaxRtrAdvInterval.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfMaxRtrAdvInterval
wfIpv6NdiscIfMaxRtrAdvInterval.description: The maximum time allowed between sending unsolicited multicast Router Advertisements, in seconds.

wfIpv6NdiscIfDefaultLifetime.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfDefaultLifetime
wfIpv6NdiscIfDefaultLifetime.description: The lifetime associated with the default router in units of seconds.

wfIpv6NdiscIfDupAddrDetectTransmits.name: wfIpv6NdiscIfDupAddrDetectTransmits
wfIpv6NdiscIfDupAddrDetectTransmits.description: The number of consecutive Neighbor Solicitations messages sent while performing Duplicate Address Detection on a tentative address. A value of zero indicates that no Duplicate Address Detection needs to be performed. A value of one indicates a single transmission with no follow up retransmission.

wfIpv6UdpInDatagrams.name: wfIpv6UdpInDatagrams
wfIpv6UdpInDatagrams.description: The total number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP users.

wfIpv6UdpNoPorts.name: wfIpv6UdpNoPorts
wfIpv6UdpNoPorts.description: The total number of received UDP datagrams for which there was no application at the destination port.

wfIpv6UdpInErrors.name: wfIpv6UdpInErrors
wfIpv6UdpInErrors.description: The number of received UDP datagrams that could not be delivered for reasons other than the lack of an application at the destination port.

wfIpv6UdpOutDatagrams.name: wfIpv6UdpOutDatagrams
wfIpv6UdpOutDatagrams.description: The total number of UDP datagrams sent from this entity.

wfIpv6UdpTable.name: wfIpv6UdpTable
wfIpv6UdpTable.description: The UDP listener table contains information about this entity's UDP end-points on which a local application is currently accepting datagrams.

wfIpv6UdpEntry.name: wfIpv6UdpEntry
wfIpv6UdpEntry.description: Information about a particular current UDP listener.

wfIpv6UdpLocalIfIndex.name: wfIpv6UdpLocalIfIndex
wfIpv6UdpLocalIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the local interface to which this entry's information pertains. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of wfIpv6IfIndex.

wfIpv6UdpLocalAddress.name: wfIpv6UdpLocalAddress
wfIpv6UdpLocalAddress.description: The local IPv6 address for this UDP listener. In the case of a UDP listener which is willing to accept datagrams for any IPv6 address associated with the interface, the value ::0 is used.

wfIpv6LogDelete.name: wfIpv6LogDelete
wfIpv6LogDelete.description: Create/Delete parameter. Default is created. Users perform a set operation on this object in order to create/delete wfIpv6Log mib object.

wfIpv6LogLevel.name: wfIpv6LogLevel
wfIpv6LogLevel.description: BGP log event level. Setting log to a specific level enables logging IPv6 events of this level and higher.

wfIpv6LogEvent.name: wfIpv6LogEvent
wfIpv6LogEvent.description: Indicates whether a log message which corresponds to the value of this attributes should be sent to the log. It affects wfIpv6LogCodes only. In order to save combined list of messages you have to set wfIpv6LogCfgEvents directly as copy of wfIpv6LogEvents.

wfIpv6LogEventDisable.name: wfIpv6LogEventDisable
wfIpv6LogEventDisable.description: Indicates whether a log event defined in wfIpv6LogEvent is to be logged.

wfIpv6LogEvents.name: wfIpv6LogEvents
wfIpv6LogEvents.description: Vector of enabled debug messages (to check only). Messages are identified via the string of bits contained within this attribute. The first octet contains bits 0 to 7, the second octet contains bits 8 to 15, and so on, with the most significant bit referring to the lowest bit number in the octet (e.g., the MSB of the first octet refers to bit 0). If a bit, i, is present and set, then the DEBUG log message with the code (i) is enabled.

wfIpv6LogCfgEvents.name: wfIpv6LogCfgEvents
wfIpv6LogCfgEvents.description: User-defined vector of enabled debug messages at boot moment. Coded as instance above

comments: Produced by pysmi-0.3.4 at Fri May 24 22:35:19 2019
On host NEERMITT-M-J0NV platform Darwin version 18.6.0 by user neermitt
